results.title: Canterbury: home of handweaving
results.brief_description: Hand weaving loom and spinning wheel manufacture in a Canterbury workshop. Shows the care and skill used in the production of these machines, each the work of one craftsman. At the Cathedral Weaving Centre, weavers can buy materials and learn the art of making fine hand-woven.

results.title: BYO: sprung
results.creator_credit: Eric Mival and Queensland.Dept. of Education. Production Services Branch
results.brief_description: One in a series of films following BYO, this episode revolves around the attitudes of the parents whose teenage son comes home drunk. A discussion starter for teenagers. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: By hook or by crook
results.creator_credit: Russell Sefton and Christian Television Association of Victoria
results.brief_description: A film about early Christian Art examining the aesthetics and in particular, that of the catacombs of Rome. Pays special attention to the culltural-historical context from which it evolved. Presented by Barry Marshall.

results.title: By Brakhage: an anthology
results.brief_description: Influential American avant-garde artist Stan Brakhage (1933-2003) made nearly four hundred films over fifty years. Addressing grand themes of birth, sex and death, Brakhage pioneered the art of handmade films - scratching, drawing and painting directly on to the film itself. This compilation contains twenty-six works by Brakhage including some of his most famous titles. Interviews and audio commentary by Brakhage, as well as an accompanying booklet, provide a fascinating insight into his philosophical and technical processes.

results.title: Button Moon
results.brief_description: Mr and Mrs Spoon and Tina T Spoon live on Junk Planet where everything is created from household items. In each adventure they visit Button Moon in their space ship. Through their telescope they see lots of interesting stories. Rated: G

results.title: Butch minds the baby
results.creator_credit: Peter Webb, Adrian Hughes and Park Village Productions
results.brief_description: A humorous film based on a short story by Damon Runyon and told through voice-over narration. This film is set in Manhattan in the summer of 1931 when the unemployment situation drives a bunch of hoodlums to approach famous safe-cracker Big Butch with a plan: if he carries out a job they have arranged, they will split the payoff. Butch foresees just one complication, his wife is away for the evening and he is babysitting John Ignatius Jnr.
